desc: This course explores pharmacodynamics and pharmacokinetics, integrating principles of pathophysiology through examining drug classifications in relation to disease processes and sympton management. Evaluation of efficacy, potential complications, and special considerations for medication administration are emphasized. Monitoring of physical signs and symptoms, diagnostic evaluation, and complications of drug therapy are reviewed. Counts toward the nursing major. Offered annually in the spring semester. Prerequisite: concurrent registration in (or previous completion of) BIO 243.
name: Pathopharmacology
prerequisites: Prerequisite: concurrent registration in (or previous completion of) BIO 243.
